name: Dan Haywood's New Hawks Triple Vinyl
description:
Five years in the making and over two hours in length, this thirty-two track, triple vinyl album is both Dan 
Haywood’s New Hawks debut record and final release. The songs are all based on Haywood’s personal 
ruminations charting his experience as a lone songwriter, poet and ornithologist travelling around rural Scotland.

The record is uncompromising in its dramatic, personal and raw interpretation - marrying country rock, 
folk and psychedelic influences, alongside Haywood’s ardent vocals. The instrumentation and arrangements are 
sometimes sparse, sometimes exquisite and sometimes cacophonous, with the band utilising guitars, fiddles, 
cellos, drums, pedal steel, piano and percussion along with some minimal use of bass, bongos and harmonium.

description:

name: Koryo Saito - Mirage
description:
Mirage is the debut long player from Tokyo–based musician, author and nursery school art teacher, Koryo Saito. Influenced as much by traditional European folk culture and French medieval music as by Japanese experimental music, Mirage moves from playful song and hum-along melodies to unearthly atmospherics and outer-limits soundscapes.

These mysteriously enchanting pieces cross the musical spectrum from folk flavoured theme tunes to ghostly sound collages and dusty field recordings via traditional song and minimal electronic composition. In essence this is an album informed as much by the juxtaposition of the modern and ancient as it is by various strands of leftfield pop, electronica and psychedelia.

name: This Is The Sound Of The Winter Journey
description:
The Winter Journey are Anthony Braithwaite and Suzy Mangion, a gentle duo out of place in Manchester, England who create gorgeous music in their drawing room as if it were only yesterday. Their album is a perfect eleven songs of vintage warmth and homely welcomes that could only be made from a collection of music recorded by hand on birthdays, Christmases and other days of rest. Both Suzy and Anthony were previously in the band George who released albums on Pickled Egg Records gathering plaudits including Pitchfork’s Top 50 albums of 2003 and toured with A Hawk and A Hacksaw. Suzy releases records under her own name and has sung on records by Piano Magic, Arbol and Big Eyes Family Players. The first 500 copies are packaged in a hand made, hand stamped and numbered limited edition.

“gorgeous tapestries of rustic country folk music...... a group dripping with quaint romanticism, bookish sophistication and lots and lots of cool refinement...... warm-blanket intimacy” Manchester Evening News

name: Robots In The Orchestra
description:
‘Robots in the Orchestra’ is the debut album from Manchester based trio I Am Your Autopilot and is a collection of ten meticulously crafted songs that effortlessly blends soulful electronics and choral vocals with chiming acoustic guitars and analogue synth oscillations. As well as garnering praise from the BBC and the Guardian, I Am Your Autopilot have collaborated with New York based multimedia artist Fredo Viola (Blue Mountain Music) who used them as his backing band for a series of European shows in early 2008, including an appearance at La Cigalle in Paris and a live session on internationally renowned music blog La Blogotheque.

 As a three-piece the sound they create belies influences as diverse as Air, Spiritualized, Simon & Garfunkel and Francois Couperin and their debut album grabs you with it’s cinematic, hearbreaking and joyful quality.

“One listen and you may well wonder how you ever survived without them”
Chris Long, BBC Manchester
